Interest: koreanculture, korean traditions, korean society, koreanwave, culture, communication, respect, age
Festivals: ['Pan African Film & Arts Festival 2022', 'Atlanta Film Festival 2022', 'Milwaukee Film Festival 2022']
Narrative:
Korean society gives a lot of importance to age  , how you interact with people depends on your place in society . Irrespective of whether you know the person or not , it is customary to respect an elder person. Calling someone whose elder than you by their first name is seen as disrespect.

Koreans do not call people who are older or have a higher position in work  than them by name . They use their title or ssi or nim after the name or title . 

Older males/females are always called oppa , hyung , unnie , noona depending on what you gender is . (Oppa- boys , unnie - girls , for girls) (Noona - girls , hyung - boys ,for boys )

Even if you are same age full name is used to call people,you are not close to. 

Only ,when a person is your family or is a close friend is first or a nick name used . 

The way you address people can indicate your degree of closeness.
Title: Be careful how  you address people in korea
